description: First attested in 1619. From Latin lūdicrus, from lūdō (“play”).

adjectives.description: ludicrous (comparative more ludicrous, superlative most ludicrous)

entries.meaning: Idiotic or unthinkable, often to the point of being funny; amusing by being plainly incongruous or absurd.
examples: He made a ludicrous attempt to run for office.
